body_html:
The patch will be upstreamed in the next few days, whenever we sync up our branch with the Github repository.

I'm afraid I don't have time to work on a AMDGPU Tensorflow StreamExecutor plugin, nor access to the necessary hardware. But if you are interested in working on one, we can definitely give you pointers.

One thought: XLA actually only uses a relatively small subset of the StreamExecutor API, so it isn't quite as imposing as it might seem. I believe the only essential pieces are those for things like opening the device, allocating memory, and launching kernels.
